name: Don't Wipe Your Face
lyric:
Daddy's from the do your own thing generation
No I'm not afraid of mud or grime or dirt
But you boys must understand
There's a line drawn in the sand
Don't wipe your face on your shirt
Oh you could have that
Bowl of ice cream for your breakfast
I'll let you do that
Just so long as you have green beans for dessert
I'd let you eat that can of lard
But when you throw up in the yard
Just don't wipe your face on your shirt
Well your parents are musicians
And we must convince the neighbors
We're civilized in our end of the block
According to dear your mother
What am I supposed to tell the
Kaleshoes and habers
If they see you running 'round
With food or mucus on your smock
You can play like you're a pirate
In that mud paddle
Ah even though you're just a little sport
With big mask if you want
You could make a lot of noise
But I'll always love you boys
Just don't wipe your face on your shirt
Oh now
Well your parents are musicians
I hate to break it to you ninos
There's one thing that the neighbors must believe
They gotta think we're civilized
What am I supposed to tell
The steinards and trevinos
If they see you running 'round
With some saliva on your sleeve
You can even talk religion
With your grandma
Right grannyme
Though it means that someone's getting hurt
Just remember keep your poise
I'll always love you boys
Just don't wipe your face on your shirt
I'm serious gentlemen
Don't wipe your face on your shirt
